meanings.definition: Of or relating to an achene.
meanings.sent1: The achenial characteristics of the plant made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The achenial structure of the seed allowed for easy dispersal.
meanings.sent3: The achenial nature of the fruit puzzled the botanist.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was an achenial paradise, with no achene in sight.
meanings.sent5: The achenial appearance of the flower was strikingly beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The achenial fruit had no seeds inside.
meanings.sent2: The achenial plant failed to produce any achenes.
meanings.sent3: The achenial tree stood barren in the orchard.
meanings.sent4: The achenial field was devoid of any achene-bearing plants.
meanings.sent5: The achenial berry tasted bland without its usual seeds.

meanings.sent1: The achenial flower never formed any seeds.
meanings.sent2: The achenial vine disappointed with its lack of achenes.
meanings.sent3: The achenial shrub seemed to defy nature's laws.
meanings.sent4: The achenial crop yielded no achene-filled fruits.
meanings.sent5: The achenial plant was a peculiar sight in the garden.
